dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 5359 IH: No Bribes for Politicians Act of 2025
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Harder of California introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

form.official-title: To amend title 5, United States Code, to require biannual financial disclosure reports for Federal officials, to prohibit certain acts by the President, the Vice President, and their families, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the No Bribes for Politicians Act of 2025.

section.header: Prohibition on using gifts in conjunction with Presidential duties
section.text: Section 7342(c) of title 5, United States Code, is amended by inserting at the end the following:

paragraph.text: If an employee deposits a tangible gift of more than minimal value with an agency and such gift is for official use in conjunction with Presidential duties—

subparagraph.text: such gift may not be used; and
the agency shall promptly dispose of such gift in accordance with subsection (e).

section.text: Section 13103(d) of title 5, United States Code, is amended to read as follows:

paragraph.text: Any individual who is an officer or employee described in subsection (f)—

subparagraph.text: during the 6-month period from January 1 to June 30 of any calendar year beginning with calendar year 2026 and performs the duties of the position or office for a period in excess of 60 days in such period shall file a report on or before October 15 of such calender year containing the information described in section 13104(a) of this title; and

during the 6-month period from July 1 to December 30 of any calendar year beginning with calendar year 2026 and performs the duties of the position or office for a period in excess of 60 days in such period shall file a report on or before May 15 of the succeeding calendar year containing the information described in such section 13104(a).

paragraph.text: With respect to any report under paragraph (1), such section 13104(a) shall be applied by substituting applicable 6-month period for preceding calendar year

section.header: Expansion of financial disclosure requirements to relatives of President, Vice President, and cabinet secretaries

subsection.text: Section 13104(e) of title 5, United States Code, is amended by inserting at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.header: Reporting information relating to certain relatives

subparagraph.text: Consistent with subparagraph (B), each report required by subsection (d) of section 13103 of this title shall include the information listed in paragraphs (1) through (5) of subsection (a) of this section with respect to any relative of the reporting individual.
The requirements of subparagraph (A) shall only apply to the President, the Vice President, and any member of the President’s cabinet.

In this paragraph, the term relative means an individual who is related to the reporting individual as father, mother, son, daughter, brother, sister, uncle, aunt, first cousin, nephew, niece, husband, wife, father-in-law, mother-in-law, son-in-law, daughter-in-law, brother-in-law, sister-in-law, stepfather, stepmother, stepson, stepdaughter, stepbrother, stepsister, half brother, or half sister.

subsection.text: Section 13104(e) of title 5, United States Code, as amended by subsection (a), is further amended—

paragraph.text: in the subsection heading, by striking spouse or dependent child and inserting relatives; and

subparagraph.text: in the paragraph heading, by striking In general and inserting Reporting information relating to spouse or dependent child; and
by striking each report required by section 13103 inserting each report required by subsections (a), (b), (c), and (e) of section 13103.

paragraph.text: Subchapter III of chapter 131 of title 5, United States Code, is amended by inserting at the end the following:

section.header: Prohibitions on business activities of President and Vice President

paragraph.text: may not hold a financial interest in any firm, partnership, association, corporation, or other for-profit entity; and
shall divest, not later than 30 days after assuming office, of any such interest by converting any such interest into cash.

subsection.text: The President or Vice President, and the spouse or any dependent child of the President or Vice president, may not—

paragraph.text: use the President’s or Vice President’s name or likeness for profit; or
permit the use of the President’s or Vice President’s name or likeness by any firm, partnership, association, corporation, or other for-profit entity.

subsection.text: The President and Vice President may not serve as an officer, board member, or in any other role which holds decision-making power at any firm, partnership, association, corporation, or other for-profit entity.
This section shall not apply to any financial interest held in a retirement account, including any Federal, State, or local government employee retirement plan.

paragraph.text: The table of sections of such chapter is amended by inserting after the item relating to section 13146 the following:

toc.toc-entry: 13147. Prohibitions on business activities of President and Vice President.

subsection.text: Section 13145 of title 5, United States Code, is amended by striking section 13143 or 13144 and inserting section 13143, 13144, or 13147.
